title: Star Trek: Picard has finally got a new trailer (and a release date)
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Star Trek: Picard got a brand new trailer at New York Comic-Con – as well as finally a confirmation date on its release.

Sir Patrick Stewart himself helped launch the latest tease of what’s to come for the iconic character, after agreeing to return to play Jean-Luc Picard once more.

Running for 10 episodes Picard will be the famous character take on a new world following the events of Star Trek: Next Generation.

It will air in the US on CBS All Access, before becoming available internationally every Friday on Amazon Prime Video.

After his years as a star fleet captain, Picard has retired and has set up home in his vineyard, willing the days away in his new content life.

Picard is drawn out of retirement for a new adventure (Picture: CBS)

The old captain still has some tricks up his sleeve (Picture: CBS)

But he is soon joined by a mysterious young woman Dahj in the new chapter of his life, who he seeks to help after coming to believe is in imminent danger.

Santiago Cabrera will play Cristobal “Chris” Rios, and will be joined by Michelle Hurd, Alison Pill, Harry Treadaway, and Evan Evagora.

Among the things awaiting the series is the return of another fan favourite character, Data (Brent Spiner), and Seven Of Nine, who were spotted in the first trailer released for the upcoming franchise addition.

More: Star Trek Star Trek: Picard star shares behind-the-scenes video of character transformation Star Trek fans petition for Captain Nog memorial in Picard following Aron Eisenberg death Star Trek merger will create 'younger and more relevant' revamp

But the team are keeping the plans for the series close to their chest, with very little to go on besides the two trailers and a smidge of information that’s found its way online.

Fans have started campaigning for a memorial in the series to the late Aron Eisenberg, who played Nog in Next Generation, and who passed away in September.

Star Trek: Picard launches 24th January 2020 on Amazon Prime Video.
